page.title: 09LONGFORD PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: LONGFORD SCHOOL WAS BUILT IN 1875 AND IT COULD HOLD 104 CHILDREN . THERE IS ALSO A HOUSE WHICH THE SCHOOL MASTER USED TO LIVE IN. IT WAS JOINED ON TO THE SCHOOL. SO THAT THE SCHOOL MASTER COULD JUST WALK IN TO HIS OFFICE AT SCHOOL TIME,THERE WAS A DOOR FROM HIS HOUSE STRAIGHT INTO THE SCHOOL. BUT NOW THE HOUSE HAS BEEN SOLD TO A PRIVATE OWNER THE DOOR HAS BEEN BLOCKED OFF FROM THE SCHOOL. NOWADAYS THERE ARE ABOUT 60 CHILDREN IN THE SCHOOL. THESE DAYS WE NEED MORE SPACE SO A WHOLE NEW INFANT UNIT HAS BEEN BUILT ON. LONGFORD SCHOOL HAS A BUS THAT GOES TO LOTS OF VILLAGES TO BRING THE CHILDREN TO SCHOOL. THE VILLAGES ARE, YEAVELEY, LONGFORD, RODSLEY, HALES GREEN AND ALKMONKTON. CHILDREN ALSO COME FROM HOLLINGTON, LOWER THURVASTON, AND SUTTON-ON-THE-HILL.
